intro: Sphaeralcea filicaulis, commonly known as the narrowleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Sphaeralcea filicaulis is adapted to arid environments and is drought-tolerant once established.
